subject: p14744884
History: Year old woman with AMS and OG tube s/p vomiting. Please confirm placement. , OG tube placement.
Impression: Tip tip of the endotracheal tube is at least 7 cm above the carina an should be advanced at least 3 cm. House staff paged. Esophageal drainage tube passes into the stomach and out of view. Right brachiocephalic vein stent unchanged in position or appearance including mild central narrowing. Lung volumes are improved substantially and any previous pulmonary edema has nearly resolved. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. No pneumothorax.
